name: fontconfig

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description: Fontconfig is a library for configuring/customizing font access

dependencies.name: font-util
dependencies.description: X.Org font package creation/installation utilities and fonts.

dependencies.name: freetype
dependencies.description:
FreeType is a freely available software library to render fonts. It is
written in C, designed to be small, efficient, highly customizable, and
portable while capable of producing high-quality output (glyph images)
of most vector and bitmap font formats.

dependencies.name: gmake
dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.

dependencies.name: gnuconfig
dependencies.description:
The GNU config.guess and config.sub scripts versioned by timestamp.
This package can be used as a build dependency for autotools packages
that ship a tarball with outdated config.guess and config.sub files.

dependencies.name: gperf
dependencies.description:
GNU gperf is a perfect hash function generator. For a given list of
strings, it produces a hash function and hash table, in form of C or C++
code, for looking up a value depending on the input string. The hash
function is perfect, which means that the hash table has no collisions,
and the hash table lookup needs a single string comparison only.

dependencies.name: libxml2
dependencies.description:
Libxml2 is the XML C parser and toolkit developed for the Gnome project
(but usable outside of the Gnome platform), it is free software
available under the MIT License.

dependencies.name: pkgconfig
dependencies.description:
pkgconf is a program which helps to configure compiler and linker flags
for development frameworks. It is similar to pkg-config from
freedesktop.org, providing additional functionality while also
maintaining compatibility.

dependent_to.name: ncl
dependent_to.description:
NCL is an interpreted language designed specifically for scientific data
analysis and visualization. Supports NetCDF 3/4, GRIB 1/2, HDF 4/5, HDF-
EOD 2/5, shapefile, ASCII, binary. Numerous analysis functions are
built-in.

dependent_to.name: poppler
dependent_to.description: Poppler is a PDF rendering library based on the xpdf-3.0 code base.

dependent_to.name: imagemagick
dependent_to.description:
ImageMagick is a software suite to create, edit, compose, or convert
bitmap images.

dependent_to.name: openscenegraph
dependent_to.description:
OpenSceneGraph is an open source, high performance 3D graphics toolkit
that's used in a variety of visual simulation applications.

dependent_to.name: xfd
dependent_to.description:
xfd - display all the characters in a font using either the X11 core
protocol or libXft2.

dependent_to.name: graphviz
dependent_to.description: Graph Visualization Software

dependent_to.name: root
dependent_to.description: ROOT is a data analysis framework.

dependent_to.name: pango
dependent_to.description:
Pango is a library for laying out and rendering of text, with an
emphasis on internationalization. It can be used anywhere that text
layout is needed, though most of the work on Pango so far has been done
in the context of the GTK+ widget toolkit.

dependent_to.name: arrayfire
dependent_to.description:
ArrayFire is a high performance software library for parallel computing
with an easy-to-use API. Its array based function set makes parallel
programming more accessible.

dependent_to.name: libxft
dependent_to.description:
X FreeType library. Xft version 2.1 was the first stand alone release of
Xft, a library that connects X applications with the FreeType font
rasterization library. Xft uses fontconfig to locate fonts so it has no
configuration files.

dependent_to.name: xterm
dependent_to.description:
The xterm program is a terminal emulator for the X Window System. It
provides DEC VT102 and Tektronix 4014 compatible terminals for programs
that can't use the window system directly.

dependent_to.name: ngspice
dependent_to.description:
ngspice is the open source spice simulator for electric and electronic
circuits.

dependent_to.name: vizglow
dependent_to.description:
VizGlow software tool is used for high-fidelity multi-dimensional
modeling of non-equilibrium plasma discharges. Note: VizGlow is licensed
software. You will need to create an account on the EsgeeTech homepage
and download VizGlow yourself. Spack will search your current directory
for a file of this format. Alternatively, add this file to a mirror so
that Spack can find it. For instructions on how to set up a mirror, see
https://spack.readthedocs.io/en/latest/mirrors.html

dependent_to.name: r-systemfonts
dependent_to.description:
System Native Font Finding. Provides system native access to the font
catalogue. As font handling varies between systems it is difficult to
correctly locate installed fonts across different operating systems. The
'systemfonts' package provides bindings to the native libraries on
Windows, macOS and Linux for finding font files that can then be used
further by e.g. graphic devices. The main use is intended to be from
compiled code but 'systemfonts' also provides access from R.

dependent_to.name: ffmpeg
dependent_to.description:
FFmpeg is a complete, cross-platform solution to record, convert and
stream audio and video.

dependent_to.name: glfw
dependent_to.description:
GLFW is an Open Source, multi-platform library for OpenGL, OpenGL ES and
Vulkan development on the desktop. It provides a simple API for creating
windows, contexts and surfaces, receiving input and events.

dependent_to.name: kitty
dependent_to.description: fast, featureful, cross-platform, GPU-based terminal emulator

dependent_to.name: qt
dependent_to.description: Qt is a comprehensive cross-platform C++ application framework.

dependent_to.name: swipl
dependent_to.description:
SWI-Prolog is a versatile implementation of the Prolog language.
Although SWI-Prolog gained its popularity primarily in education, its
development is mostly driven by the needs for application development.
This is facilitated by a rich interface to other IT components by
supporting many document types and (network) protocols as well as a
comprehensive low-level interface to C that is the basis for high-level
interfaces to C++, Java (bundled), C#, Python, etc (externally
available). Data type extensions such as dicts and strings as well as
full support for Unicode and unbounded integers simplify smooth exchange
of data with other components.

dependent_to.name: vim
dependent_to.description:
Vim is a highly configurable text editor built to enable efficient text
editing. It is an improved version of the vi editor distributed with
most UNIX systems. Vim is often called a "programmer's editor," and so
useful for programming that many consider it an entire IDE. It's not
just for programmers, though. Vim is perfect for all kinds of text
editing, from composing email to editing configuration files.

dependent_to.name: libgd
dependent_to.description:
GD is an open source code library for the dynamic creation of images by
programmers. GD is written in C, and "wrappers" are available for Perl,
PHP and other languages. GD creates PNG, JPEG, GIF, WebP, XPM, BMP
images, among other formats. GD is commonly used to generate charts,
graphics, thumbnails, and most anything else, on the fly. While not
restricted to use on the web, the most common applications of GD involve
website development.

dependent_to.name: cairo
dependent_to.description: Cairo is a 2D graphics library with support for multiple output devices.

dependent_to.name: qt-base
dependent_to.description: Qt Base (Core, Gui, Widgets, Network, ...)

dependent_to.name: octave
dependent_to.description:
GNU Octave is a high-level language, primarily intended for numerical
computations. It provides a convenient command line interface for
solving linear and nonlinear problems numerically, and for performing
other numerical experiments using a language that is mostly compatible
with Matlab. It may also be used as a batch-oriented language.

dependent_to.name: gimp
dependent_to.description:
GIMP is a cross-platform image editor available for GNU/Linux, macOS,
Windows and more operating systems. It is free software, you can change
its source code and distribute your changes. Whether you are a graphic
designer, photographer, illustrator, or scientist, GIMP provides you
with sophisticated tools to get your job done. You can further enhance
your productivity with GIMP thanks to many customization options and 3rd
party plugins.

dependent_to.name: glvis
dependent_to.description: GLVis: an OpenGL tool for visualization of FEM meshes and functions

dependent_to.name: py-matplotlib
dependent_to.description:
Matplotlib is a comprehensive library for creating static, animated, and
interactive visualizations in Python.

dependent_to.name: gxsview
dependent_to.description:
Gxsview is a stand-alone multi-platform integrated tool to visualize
input data of Monte Carlo radiation transport calculation code, MCNP5,
and PHITS3. It consists of 3D, 2D, cross-section, and input file
viewers. Also, this software is capable of exporting in 2D(png, jpg, and
xpm) or 3D(stl, vtk, vtp and ply) formats.
